text: Kyle, you would want to implement the api call using AJAX to make that call if the api allows it.
Not sure exactly what you are looking for, let me know if that helps or you need more information

Hello, we just created an app using this example app and we are having trouble figuring out what is the best way to deploy it in production. We'd appreciate the help of someone who did it before. Thanks <https://github.com/HubSpot/integration-examples-nodejs/tree/master/webhooks-app> <@U012TAH79BQ>
Hey <@UDU6KEBFB> Do you have a preference on what provider you use?
not really AWS, Google Cloud, Etc. don't care

Great, well I happened to recently do it on Google Cloud. It was actually pretty straightforward. I create a machine using <https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/quickstart-linux|these instructions> chosing a container-optimized machine image. Then I `ssh`’d into the machine via the google console and did a `git clone` of my repo to get the files onto the newly created virtual machine. From there I just ran `docker-compose up --build` and it worked
Ok thank you we will look into this thank you
